Author: artik123#2884
Content:
I think that the goal should be so that every developer could have his own chain with his own cc up and running over a weekend. 

Including his logic, possibly with an oracle, in his own preffered programming language and on windows.

Maybe we could contact zcash to see is they have plans to make a port for windows.

If they don't, then maybe we could take it on ourselves. (As far as I know it is not a priority for them because they are a digital currency and not a platform. I think here we differ from them)

I've looked around and found this guy.

Author: artik123#2884
Content:
He is enthusiastic to do such porting, but he couldn't get the funding.

The funny thing is that he is already involved within komodo ecosystem/pirate chain...

Author: artik123#2884
Content: Maybe we can contact him and get it done.

Author: artik123#2884
Content: Can i compile it on windows using visual studio?

Author: artik123#2884
Content: @Decker can I? Last time this project was updated was more than half a year ago, and I don't see *.sln file

Author: artik123#2884
Content: But I do see *.pro file. Seems It is compiling on windows but just not up to date

Author: Decker#3767
Content: @artik123 Compiling with MSVC not longer supported. Use default `static` branch and cross-compile Komodo-Qt for Windows from *nix.

Author: Decker#3767
Content: If you have any other questions about Komodo-Qt, plz ask them in #wallet-ocean-qt .

Author: Decker#3767
Content:
> Last time this project was updated was more than half a year ago
Latest release was 19 days ago. 19 days is not "half a year".
